questions.question: What is the primary purpose of Advisory Circular AC101-1?

answers.text: To establish mandatory regulations that operators must follow
To provide practical guidance for RPAS operators under 25kg during the regulatory transition
To replace Part 101 and Part 102 regulatory requirements
To outline penalties for operators who do not comply with new rules

questions.feedback: AC101-1 is specifically designed to provide practical, CAA-endorsed guidance for operators transitioning to the December 2025 framework, focusing on compliance pathways and best practices.

questions.question: What is the critical deadline for commercial operators to submit updated Part 102 certification applications?
questions.feedback: 30 April 2026 is the critical deadline for commercial operators to submit updated Part 102 certification applications during Phase 2. Missing this deadline could delay authorization.

questions.question: During Phase 1 (Foundation), what is the CAA's primary approach to enforcement?

answers.text: Strict penalties for any non-compliance, regardless of circumstances
Education and support, with no enforcement action for good-faith compliance efforts
Selective enforcement only against large commercial operators
No oversight at all—operators can do whatever they want during Phase 1

questions.feedback: During Phase 1, the CAA prioritizes education and stakeholder support. Operators making good-faith efforts to understand and implement changes are not subject to enforcement action.

questions.question: When the CAA conducts a compliance audit, what is the most important thing you can show to demonstrate your compliance commitment?

answers.text: Expensive safety equipment and modern aircraft
Clear written procedures, maintenance records, flight logs, and training documentation
Verbal explanations of why you think your operations are safe
Insurance documents showing your liability coverage

questions.feedback: During audits, comprehensive documentation—procedures, records, training records—demonstrates that you take compliance seriously and can show ongoing compliance capability and practices.
